author: Staff Reporter
text:
Examination of eye witnesses in the pujari suicide case began at Principal District and Sessions Court here on Wednesday.

Thenkarai police produced 10 out of 22 witnesses before the court in the morning. All the seven accused, including O. Raja, brother of Finance Minister O. Panneerselvam, were also present. Examination of first witness, Subbu Raj, father of the deceased, was completed in the evening. Reacting to a series of questions raised by the defence counsel, Subbu Raj said that the police did not enquire him and only an RDO enquiry was done. He said that blood stains were present on the body of his son.

When Special Public Prosecutor B. Mohan appealed to Principal District Judge R. Poornima to adjourn the case for a long time, she turned down the request, saying that trial would continue on a daily basis. After repeated requests from Mr. Mohan, the judge adjourned the case till Friday. “If both lawyers wished, the court will conduct the trial on Saturday too,” she added.

The judge also dismissed the petition filed by the Special Public Prosecutor seeking inclusion of additional sections in the charge sheet as not maintainable. Prosecution could not add sections in the charge sheet submitted in the court, she added.

Charges were framed against O. Raja and others on December 15, 2015. Theni district court had transferred the case to Dindigul district court on November 25 last year, as per direction of the Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court.

S. Nagamuthu (22) of T. Kallupatti, a Dalit, who worked as a pujari in Kailasanathar hill temple in Periyakulam, committed suicide by hanging on December 8, 2012, after he was allegedly subjected to harassment.
title: Examination of witnesses in pujari case begins
